contentrichtext.text: {{incomplete list|date=February 2012}} This is a list of [[board games]] invented, developed and/or published in [[Japan]]. {| class="wikitable" |- ! Game name !! Year !! Publisher/Designer (Japan) !! Players !! Gameplay style !! Similar Games |- |{{nihongo|[[Go (game)|Go]]|囲碁|igo}}||?||Traditional||2||Strategic territory and surrounding game||''weiqi'' in Chinese, ''baduk'' in Korean |- |{{nihongo|[[Gomoku]]|五目並べ|gomokunarabe}}||?||Traditional||2|||Strategic abstract game played with Go pieces on a Renju board (15x15), goal to reach five in a row|| [[Renju]], [[Four in a row]], Irensei |- | {{nihongo|[[Irensei]]|囲連星}} || ? ||Traditional || 2 ||Strategic abstract game played with Go pieces on a Go board (19x19); unites elements of the game of Go with those of Gomoku ||Go, Gomoku |- |{{nihongo|[[Jinsei Game]]|人生ゲーム|jin-sei gēmu}}|| 1967 || [[Takara]] || ? || Japanese adaption of [[The Game of Life]] || The Game of Life |- | {{nihongo|[[Renju]]|連珠}}|| ? ||Traditional || 2 || Strategic five-in-a-row game with equal chances for both players ||[[Pente]], [[Gomoku]] |- |{{nihongo|[[Shadow Hunters]]|シャドウハンターズ|shadō hantāzu}}||2005 ||[[Game Republic]] ||4-8 ||Supernatural themed, strategic, secret team play ||[[Bang!]], [[Mafia (party game)|Mafia]] |- |{{nihongo|[[Riichi Mahjong]]|リーチ麻雀|Riichi Maajan}}||?||Traditional||4||Chinese Mahjong with Japanese rules ||Mahjong |- |{{Nihongo|[[Shogi]] and [[Shogi variant|variants]]|将棋|shōgi|generals' chess| Japanese chess}} || ? ||Traditional ||2 || Played on a 9x9 board; can use captured pieces against opponent ||[[Chess]] |- |{{nihongo|[[Sugoroku]]|双六}}|| ?|| Traditional || ? || Race game, two variants || [[Backgammon]] (variant), [[Snakes and Ladders]] (variant) |} [[Category:Board games|Japanese board games]] [[Category:Japanese games|*board games]] [[Category:Lists of games|Japanese board games]]
